questions.question_text: Which two actions help limit the attack surface of your Docker container? (Choose two.)

choices.E: Download images over HTTPS supporting sites.
choices.B: Run all services in a single image.
choices.C: Use version tags for base images and dependencies.
choices.A: Run only a single service in each container.
choices.D: Use Kali Linux as a base image.

discussion.content: As I think, "A" & "C" is the best.

Selected Answer: AE
Guys, ofc it's E.
Never download anything from non-HTTPS sites, even containers. Come on... you can not even be sure it's a legitimate site if it's not-HTTPS.

comments.content: it is not about the application security but it is about limiting of the attack surface, so i think A and C

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
The answer C is definitely wrong. A tag is a label and it doesn't help secure the container / app in any way.

It's about the application security and secure file transfers of the application package.

A and E

A and C i guess, E will is not required as Images have their checksusm verified? 
https://snyk.io/blog/10-docker-image-security-best-practices/

I think A and E are correct.

Attack surface refers to the "points of entry" that are vulnerable in an application.

For A, limiting the amount of services to 1 in a container limits the reach of an attacker in the application.

For E, you ensure the data integrity of the image when using HTTPS (TLS encryption).

questions.question_text: A DevOps engineer has built a container to host a web-server and it must run as an executable. Which command must be configured in a Dockerfile to accomplish this goal?
Which Docker command is used to start an interactive Bash shell in a running container named "test"?

choices.A: when there is a change to a username or password in the Docker secrets
choices.C: when a fix for a security vulnerability is released
choices.E: when the base image is nearing the end of life
choices.B: when the application has a new release
choices.D: when a change is needed to an environment variable in the Dockerfile

questions.question_text: What are two reasons a Docker golden image should be updated? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: It's C & E. It's not B, because it's about the golden image that is the source of other containers.

questions.question_text:
A company has experienced serious growth and the hosted applications are getting more and more hits. Based on the increased work load, applications have started to show signs of reduced performance, which is affecting the user experience.
Which two server metrics should be tracked to ensure that the customer experience remains within acceptable limits? (Choose two.)
